statements.statement: I am familiar with the song, but it is not my favorite.
I know I have heard this song, but do not know where.
I love this song, I know every word!
I used to like this song, but it was way too overplayed.
I cannot stand this song.
I like this song because it is simple and tells a story.
This song triggers me in a bad way.
This some is different from modern pop.
This is just a dance song.
The song is catchy and the beat is infectious.
I do not like the lyrics.
I cannot understand most of the words.
I do not know what this song is about.
This song is about nothing in particular.
This song is about school shooting.
This song is about high school and that odd time in our life.
This songs reminds me of that time period when it came out.
This song is about sneakers.
This song is threatening.
This song is a cautionary tale.
I tune the lyrics out and listen to the music around it.
This song makes me feel sad.
I have no feelings about this song.
This song makes feel anxiety/fear.
This song makes me feel angry/disgust.
This song makes me happy.
I am not sure who the band is.
I am indifferent towards the band.
I like the song but not the band.
I like this genre of music but not the band.
I’ve seen the band in concert.
This one of my favorite bands.
Lyrics were dark but surrounded with a happy sound.
I like the lyrics more than I should have.
I like how the lyrics tell a story.
Lyrics creep me out.
The beat is fun; I find myself tapping my foot.
I didn’t pay attention to the meaning.
The song probably has a deeper meaning than what I think it is.
The singer is jealous of the better things the other kids in school have.
The singer may be psychotic and is using the song as a cry for help.
High school isn’t a safe place nowadays.
It’s relatable because lots of people want what others have.
I like the song because there is a need to spread awareness about school shootings.
I relate to the song being I was an antisocial kid.
I don’t see how anyone could find this song relatable.
I think people are oblivious to the song’s meaning and what the singer is intending to do.
The message is interesting, but I cannot relate to it.
How someone can seem happy and upbeat like the song, however hide a dark side like the lyrics do.
This song promotes violence.
